item.title: Elden Ring Players Defeat Rellana Without Entering Her Arena
item.description:
Highlights

  • Elden Ring players have found a way to cheese the difficult Rellana boss fight without even entering her arena.
  • Finding exploits in Elden Ring, such as skipping boss fights, is common among players looking to simplify the game.
  • The discovery of new exploits like a risk-free way to defeat Rellana adds to the excitement of playing through the DLC.

An Elden Ring player recently found a way to defeat Rellana without ever entering her arena. Elden Ring is known for its difficult fights, and this DLC boss is no exception. However, this player found a way to cheese the fight without ever having to actually face the boss.

Finding exploits within Elden Ring isn't new to the game's community. Various Elden Ring boss fights have several ways to be cheesed or made easier, many of which can happen by accident to players. This is even true for DLC bosses, including a simple exploit that makes Rellana, one of the harder bosses in the early part of the Shadow of Erdtree DLC, easier to defeat. The wide variety of exploits in the game like this keeps players in search of new ways to simplify boss fights.

This is exactly the case with Twitter user Ziostorm, who found a completely risk-free way of defeating Rellana, one of the harder bosses in the early parts of the Shadow of Erdtree DLC. Ziostorm discovered that by standing at the rear fog wall by Highroad Cross, players can fire long-range spells into Rellana's arena. The spells still manage to hit her, dealing damage that can be seen on her health bar. Eventually, her health bar will hit zero and the fog gates will dissipate, allowing players to travel forward. Alongside this, players still earn the usual rewards from the fight, despite never actually entering Rellana's arena.

Elden Ring DLC Bosses Have a Variety of Exploits For Players to Defeat Them

This isn't the first time that players have found a way to make the Rellana boss fight easier or skip it in its entirety. As with any FromSoftware game, there are plenty of alternate paths for players to take in order to progress through the game. In the case of Rellana, a shortcut to Scadu Altus allows players to skip over the boss fight entirely by bypassing Castle Ensis. Although some players prefer to play the game as intended, the variety of bugs, exploits, and secrets can still be exciting for others.

The discovery of yet another way to cheese an Elden Ring boss fight adds to the ever-growing list of exploits and secrets within the game. Whether it was intended or not, players of the Shadow of Erdtree DLC have another way to defeat Rellana and possibly skip a pretty difficult fight. Players who still wish to face the boss as intended can find plenty of ways to simplify the battle, including ways to counter one of Rellana's deadliest attacks. Regardless of the path taken, players have a variety of options when it comes to playing through the Elden Ring DLC.

item.title: Visions of Mana May Have Timed Its Release Date Poorly
item.description:
Highlights

  • Visions of Mana marks a long-awaited return for the Mana franchise, bringing modernized gameplay and beautiful visuals to fans after a decade.
  • Despite its significance, the game faces tough competition with a crowded release window in August, potentially leading to overshadowing by bigger titles.
  • A slight delay to a less crowded month like September or December could benefit Visions of Mana, giving it more room to shine and reach its sales potential.

Visions of Mana may not be as big of a title as, say, Final Fantasy 16 or Dragon Quest 12 , but it's still a notable release for Square Enix since it's the first mainline installment in the Mana franchise since 2006's Dawn of Mana on the PS2. Even though this beloved JRPG series has received new entries as recently as 2022, it's largely been relegated to spin-offs, remasters, and remakes for nearly two decades. As such, Visions of Mana serves as a revival of sorts for the long-running franchise.

Barring any delays, Visions of Mana is currently slated for release later this month, on August 29. As exciting as it is that it's coming out so soon, this upcoming JRPG may be launching at an inopportune time because its release window is quite packed; so much so, in fact, that the game could end up being overshadowed by some of the bigger titles launching during the second half of the month. If this does indeed happen, then instead of being a triumphant return for the Man a series, Visions of Mana could end up falling flat on its face sales-wise, regardless of its critical acclaim or lack thereof.

Visions of Mana's August 29 Release Date Could Be to Its Detriment

The Second Half of August is Stacked When It Comes to Game Releases

When it comes to game releases, the last two weeks of August are shaping up to be some of the biggest stretches of the year yet. Roughly 9 days before the launch of Visions of Mana , for instance, the highly-anticipated action RPG Black Myth: Wukong is set to come out on August 20 for PlayStation 5 and PC, with an Xbox Series X/S version arriving at a later date. Meanwhile, on August 22, 2024, The War Within , the next big expansion for Blizzard's long-running MMORPG World of Warcraft , will come out two days after Wukong in early access, whereas its full release is on August 26. As if that wasn't enough, Sony Interactive Entertainment's Concord is coming out a day later, on August 23, for both PS5 and PC.

Perhaps the most noteworthy release in the second half of August, though, is Star Wars Outlaws , the upcoming sci-fi action title by Ubisoft subsidiary Massive Entertainment. Billed as the first open-world Star Wars game, this highly awaited title is shaping up to be one of Ubisoft's biggest and potentially most successful launches of the year, despite the somewhat mixed reception it has received from fans so far. Star Wars Outlaws comes out on August 30, only a day after the release of Visions of Mana .

Visions of Mana Might Fail to Meet Square Enix's Expectations if It Gets Overshadowed

None of the games set to release in the latter half of August fall under the same genre as Visions of Mana , so they may not appeal to the same audiences. However, this upcoming JRPG could easily end up being overlooked due to the conversation being dominated by some of the other heavy-hitters in the month, like Black Myth: Wukong and Star Wars Outlaws . This resulting in Square Enix being disappointed in Visions of Mana 's sales wouldn't be all that surprising. After all, the Japanese publisher has often complained about its games failing to meet sales expectations, like Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth . Just recently, for example, the firm stated that some of its blockbuster releases, like Final Fantasy 16 and Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth , both fell below its initial projections.

A Slight Delay Could Benefit Visions of Mana

In order to lower its chances of underperforming, perhaps a late September or December release might be better for Visions of Mana , as those two periods are less crowded, at least in terms of major AAA titles. In fact, the only major games launching in the second half of September include Epic Mickey: Rebrushed , Greedfall 2 (in early access), and The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom , among a handful of others. December, on the other hand, is devoid of big releases entirely at the time of writing. With how vacant they are compared to August, these two release windows could give Visions of Mana a lot more breathing room than the game currently has. A delay may upset some fans, but it could be just what the title needs in order to reach its maximum sales potential.

item.title: How to Fix Fallout London Crashes
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Fixing Fallout London Crashes

The Fallout franchise has seen a massive spike in players after the successful Fallout TV show on Amazon Prime. Fallout 4 , in particular, has received a lot of attention, with new players praising the game for its phenomenal world and storytelling. Considering that Fallout 4 is a great game, it should come as no surprise that the community is constantly churning out mods.

Speaking of mods, the Fallout London mod has gained a lot of attention recently. However, many players have run into issues. Since many players are facing crashes as soon as they start the game, this guide will cover everything there is to know about fixing Fallout London crashes, along with other useful information.

Fixing Fallout London Crashes

Fallout London can crash for different reasons, but most players have reported facing crashes after the train cutscene. Fortunately, all is not lost, as players can fix these crashes by following these simple steps:

  1. Download the Buffout 4 mod from Nexus mods and place it in the Fallout 4 folder. Do not download any additional files when prompted.
  2. Look for the F4SE folder in the Buffout 4 zip file and copy it.
  3. Locate the F4SE folder in the Fallout 4 folder and replace it with the one from the Buffout 4 zip file.
  4. Now, locate the f4se_loader.exe file and launch the mod. Use this executable file every time you need to launch the mod. To make it easily accessible, create a shortcut on your desktop.
  5. When you want to start the mod, right-click on f4se_loader.exe and select Run as administrator. If you do not want to do this every time, access the compatibility settings in the Properties menu and tick always run as administrator.

After following the steps mentioned above, you will not run into major crashes, especially after the train cutscene. But if you are facing issues due to the Weapon Debris setting, then download this mod to fix it.

If you continue to face crashes and you have tried all available workarounds, consider restarting your PC. If all else fails, consider switching your PC off and on again.

Fixing Infinite Loading Screen in Fallout London

Like Fallout 4 , Fallout London has long loading screens, but some players have reported being stuck on infinite loading screens. If you are facing similar issues, press ALT + Tab on the keyboard, and then press it again to return to the game.

item.title: Quidditch Champions is Taking a Page Out of the Rocket League Playbook
item.description:
Highlights

  • Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions is the first quidditch-focused game since 2003, offering fans a chance at World Cup glory.
  • Launching on PS Plus could boost Quidditch Champions into mainstream success, despite stiff competition from other free-to-play titles.
  • The $30 price tag and day-one release on PS Plus may make Quidditch Champions a breakout hit, following the success of Rocket League.

When Hogwarts Legacy was released back in early 2023, many longtime Harry Potter fans were disappointed that the action RPG didn't include a quidditch minigame of some sort. It turned out, though, that this omission wasn't made without reason, as Warner Brothers announced in April of that year that the fictional sport was getting its own standalone game in the form of a competitive multiplayer title dubbed Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions . This upcoming game may not share the same art style as Hogwarts Legacy , but Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions is catching the attention of many fans nonetheless, since it's the first quidditch-focused game of its kind since 2003's Harry Potter: Quidditch World Cup , which was released over 20 years ago.

Given how immensely popular the franchise is, it wouldn't be surprising if the Harry Potter name alone is enough to turn Quidditch Champions into a breakout hit. However, licensed games aren't necessarily guaranteed successes, as recent titles like Marvel's Avengers underperformed commercially, despite being attached to popular IPs in pop culture. The barrier to entry to Quidditch Champions is somewhat lower for PlayStation owners, since it'll be a day-one addition to the PlayStation Plus monthly games catalog in September. Charging $30 for this title may be a risky move, but this tactic of launching the game into PS Plus can make it work, just like it did for Rocket League back in the day.

Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions Could Replicate Rocket League's Success With PS Plus

Rocket League Started Off as a Buy-To-Play Game on PS Plus, Like Quidditch Champions

Rocket League might be free-to-play today, but when the game first came out in mid-2015, it was actually a paid title, just like Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions . Indeed, the now-multiplatform vehicular sports game initially launched on PlayStation 4 and Windows with a $20 price tag attached to it. Sales of the multiplayer title exceeded developer Psyonic's expectations on both platforms. Perhaps what was most impressive, though, was Rocket League 's success on PlayStation, where the game ended up becoming the most downloaded PS4 title of 2016, despite the game being a year old at that point. Much of this popularity on PlayStation could be attributed to the fact that it was a day-one release on PlayStation Plus.

Compared to what Microsoft does with Xbox Game Pass, Sony typically doesn't add many day-and-date releases to its flagship gaming subscription service. On the contrary, the publisher has openly criticized the idea on multiple occasions, citing it as something that would disrupt the company's virtuous cycle of AAA releases and deteriorate their quality. Even still, Sony has put a decent smattering of titles on PS Plus day-one throughout the years, including recent releases like Animal Well , Stray , Sea of Stars , Tchia , and Meet Your Maker .

It's important to note, though, that the overwhelming majority of these titles are indie games; even Rocket League itself started off as an indie game before being bought up by Epic Games in 2019. This makes Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions 's day-and-date PS Plus release more significant, as it's one of the first AAA titles to launch on to the service day one, third-party or otherwise.

Launching Day-One on PS Plus Could Turn Quidditch Champions Into a Massive Hit

Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions launching on PS Plus could be just the kind of push the game may need in order to propel it into mainstream hit territory. This upcoming sports title may face stiff competition from free-to-play multiplayer releases like Fortnite , Fall Guys , and even Rocket League , but its PS Plus launch will likely give the game far more exposure than it may otherwise get, especially if it lives up to expectations. Ultimately, though, Harry Potter: Quidditch Champions ' success largely hinges on its quality; if the game isn't up to snuff, then it could fail to catch on despite its day-one PS Plus release, like Foamstars and Destruction All-Stars before it.

item.title: Lengthy Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom Trailer Details World and Abilities
item.description:
Highlights

  • A new trailer for The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom details the regions that will appear in the game, along with new mechanics.
  • Players will be able to visit the Gerudo Desert, Jabul Waters, Eldin Volcano, and Goron City in the upcoming puzzle game.
  • Along with Zelda's Echo ability, she will also be able to use Bind and Reverse Bind.

Fans are learning tons of new details about The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom with the most recently released trailer. Announced as the next entry in the Zelda series during a Nintendo Direct in mid-June, the new game is a dream come true for fans eager to see Princess Zelda as the main character. In Echoes of Wisdom , Princess Zelda must discover why rifts have begun appearing across Hyrule and where they are taking the inhabitants of the Kingdom, including Link.

Echoes of Wisdom will feature unique gameplay never seen before in a Zelda game. To solve most puzzles, defeat enemies, and traverse across Hyrule, Zelda will use an ability to create Echoes, which are replicas of objects found in the game's environment. It was previously believed that Echoes would be the main mechanic in Echoes of Wisdom , but according to a new trailer, that's not all.

A five-minute overview trailer released on August 5 revealed that Princess Zelda will have two additional powers in Echoes of Wisdom , along with a four-legged friend to help her through her journey. The video also gives players plenty of information regarding the expansive lands they'll be able to visit in the upcoming title, along with fun consumables and cosmetics set to appear, useful for gaining unique bonuses and special abilities. Notably, smoothie shops will appear throughout the game, tasking players with mixing specific ingredients to gain helpful buffs.

Information Revealed In The Legend Of Zelda: Echoes Of Wisdom Overview Trailer

  • More abilities:
    • Bind
    • Reverse Bond

  • Modes of transportation:
    • Horses
    • Fast-travel

  • Regions in Hyrule:
    • Gerudo Desert
    • Jabul Waters
    • Eldin Volcano
    • Faron Wetlands

Beyond the ability to create Echoes, Zelda will also be able to use Bind and Reverse Bond in Echoes of Wisdom . Bind forces an object or enemy to follow Zelda's movements, making it possible to drop creatures off cliffs, dig up treasure, or remove items blocking a pathway. Reverse Bond works the other way around, making Zelda follow the object or enemy's movements instead, allowing her to potentially fly or move faster. The possibilities are endless, especially if players combine Echoes with these abilities.

According to the overview trailer, fans will be able to visit familiar regions in Echoes of Wisdom , including the Gerudo Desert, Jabul Waters, Eldin Volcano, and Goron City. To make getting around easier, Zelda can summon her trusty horse by using a carrot, and upon reaching new areas, fast travel points will become available. T he Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom promises to be a whimsical addition to an ever-growing library of Zelda titles when it releases on September 26, 2024.
